titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Theatre Festivals Collection, 1935-2012 SPEC.TRI.0013
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Zoe MacLeod

publicationstmt.publisher: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-10-26T13:30-0400

repository.corpname: Ohio State University Libraries Special Collections

did.abstract: The Theatre Festivals Collection contains programs, advertising materials, and ephemera from domestic and international (mainly European) theatre festivals. Many theatre festivals have been established to promote various types of theatre or to promote the work of beginning playwrights and performers.
did.physdesc: (19) 5" letter document boxes; (1) 2.5" legal document box

origination.label: creator
origination.corpname: Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee Theatre Research Institute.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of Materials
arrangement.p: The materials are arranged alphabetically by name of festival.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [identification of item], Theatre Festivals Collection, SPEC.TRI.0013, Jerome Lawrence and Robert E. Lee Theatre Research Institute, Ohio State University

accessrestrict.head: Access to Materials
accessrestrict.p: Materials in this collection are available for use, but may be used in the Thompson Library Special Collections reading room only.

userestrict.head: Use of Materials
userestrict.p: Materials in this collection may be protected by copyright, and are made available for research and educational purposes. In general, the OSU Libraries do not own the copyright for materials from our collections and cannot grant copyright permissions for these materials. The user is responsible for making a final determination of copyright status. If copyright protection applies, permission must be obtained from the copyright holder to reuse, publish, or reproduce the work beyond the bounds of fair use or other exceptions to the law. Works in the public domain are not protected by copyright and do not require permission to use.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Finding aid written by Zoe MacLeod, 2017 October

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Numerous theatre festivals have been established to promote various types of theatre, such as the works of Shakespeare or George Bernard Shaw. Many festivals, such as fringe festivals, promote the work of beginning playwrights and performers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Theatre Festivals Collection contains programs, advertising materials, and ephemera from domestic and international (mainly European) theatre festivals. The materials date from 1935 to 2012.
